text: Sommely update - CPU and BLE boards should be done today.
Battery boards are a different can of worms. Hoping to catch Shashi either at TFNW or at BCC tonight to discuss.
We either need to scrape the mask away or have them attach the batteries using a type of flux that might eat away at the mask.
Ah. Was hoping for an easy fix to those battery boards.
"We" as in uncorked? Maybe we could send them out to a service like this : <http://www.micronlaser.com/Laser_Soldermask_Removal.html>
Or make a laser ablation tool ourselves (not sure how to do this correctly)
what could go wrong?
Burned interns?
Detached retinas?
no risk at all then?
Nothing insurance can't cover
lets make two!
Laser arrives tomorrow :)
Oh and I ordered those two types of flux. Should be here tomorrow
Sweet
Do you have stats on the laser?
With a through hole the flux is probably better
40w tube
Hmm, if we can control the pulse length then we could ablate. The problem is the variable focal depth of the through hole. Also not knowing the properties of the solder mask and any other unknowns
Tomorrow during business hours I will consult some old colleagues on prepping, handling, and cleaning parts when dealing with flux.
